title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 2
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Received SYNTAX, DANCE OF DEATH, and PITCAIRN, which last I have read from end to end since its arrival, with vast improvement.

title: The Story of My Life, volumes 4-6
author: Hare, Augustus J. C. (Augustus John Cuthbert)

title: The Story of My Life, volumes 4-6
author: Hare, Augustus J. C. (Augustus John Cuthbert)

title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Not one single anecdote, incident, remark, image, sentiment, or feeling, does the Stick utter ; and yet he pretends to have been hand and glove with Ratcliffe, Mead, Askew, Pitcairn, and Baillie !

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: About two miles in advance, a road leads ofi" from the left to Redgorton, Monedie, and Pitcairn Green village and spinning-mills.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Received Syntax, Dance of Death, and Pitcairn, which last I have read from end to end since its arrival, with vast improvement.

title: Journal of a lady of quality;
author: Schaw, Janet
snippet: I hope it is not the Pitcairn that was married to a Miss Dalrymple, as I know many of her relations.* But tho' 'tis all false together, I hope the publisher  will be hanged, for they have vexed me, tho' I do not believe them.

title: The works of the Right Rev. John Sage,
author: Sage, John
snippet: This, no doubt, was a discouragement to all others of anywit or probity to undertake it, for if it was to be done to anygood purpose at all, Pitcairn was as sit for doing of it as anyof the sect ; and if he gave it over, after so much deliberationabout it, it was to be presumed there was frost in it ; it wasnot safe to meddle with it.
